RESOLVED_ENTITIES.this circuit: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: federal court reviewing cases related to border patrol stops and searches, with a panel majority attempting to apply precedents in a principled way
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical boundary relevant to the case and location of the incident, 115 miles south of the stop in Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway: highways where border patrol agents may stop persons, including locations near the US-Mexico border, such as in Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: state where the defendant was stopped, location of Interstate Highway and events took place, 115 miles north of the Mexico/United States border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico border: geographical boundary relevant to the case and location of the incident, reference point for distance
